body:
I tried this code:

```rust
/**
to summon the cheerleader, use the following sequence: *\o/*
*/
pub fn cheerleader() {}
```
[https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=1a47ac30baafb8ad5bd90d566e00d4d9](playground)

(I actually encountered this when trying to document a router and included a doctest with a literal like `"/some/route/*"`, but the cheerleader is more fun)

I expected to see this happen: compilation success

Instead, this happened:
`error[E0758]: unterminated block doc-comment`
`Syntax Error: Missing trailing `*/` symbols to terminate the block comment [syntax-error]`

### Meta
This happens on all current rustc channels

I don't know if this is a bug or a "surprising feature" but with no knowledge of the implementation I would have expected the compiler to ignore text content including `/*` inside of a doc comment until the equivalent of the following regex is reached `/\n\s*\*\//`

Please let me know if this might be an approachable first contribution to rustc and I'll give it a shot
